doc: <!-- Please don't delete this template or we'll close your issue -->
<!-- Issues that contain questions or support requests will be closed. -->
<!-- Before creating an issue please make sure you are using the latest version of webpack. -->
<!-- Check if this feature needs to be implemented in a plugin or loader instead -->
<!-- If yes: file the issue on the plugin/loader repo -->
<!-- Features related to the development server should be filed on this repo instead -->
When one has multiple dynamic imports in one entry, the ability do make sure they are not merged into one chunk.

If there are many dynamic imports in an entry, but only one of them might be called a session, it may make sense to only have one import per chunk rather than always putting all dynamic imports in an entry in a chunk.
**What is motivation or use case for adding/changing the behavior?**
**How should this be implemented in your opinion?**
Perhaps through a magic comment, something like webpackOwnChunk: true?
**Are you willing to work on this yourself?**
no, tried to look at the source to see if I could figure out how to do it but had no idea where to even get started.
